source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Spikelets 3–5 mm long; lemmas c.2 mm long, longer than upper glume; perennial
Spikelets 4–10 mm long; lemmas 2.5 mm long or more, subequal to upper glumel often annual

Panicle branches soon widely divergent or deflexed; spikelets mostly 4–5-flowered, confined to the upper parts of the branches and pedicellate or terminal on lateral branchlets; mostly salt lakes of the volcanic plain

Panicle remaining narrow and contracted at maturity; spikelets mostly more than 5-flowered, many sessile or subsessile along the branches; mostly near-coastal saltmarsh and saline areas of the north-west
